title: Temporary driving licenses for tourists to be issued at BIA from today
byline: A new service counter for the issuance of necessary driving licenses to foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka for travel will be launched today (03) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) premises in Katunayake, Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Kamal Amarasinghe, stated.

title: Final Kumbal Perahera of Kandy Esala Festival to take to the streets tonight
byline: The fifth and final Kumbal Perahera of the Kandy Esala Festival is scheduled to parade the streets of Kandy tonight (03).

title: Cloudy skies, heavy showers expected in several areas today
byline: Cloudy skies can be expected over most parts of the island today (3), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: India on path to becoming third-largest economy, says Modi
byline: Asserting that India is on the path to becoming the world’s third-largest economy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday that the country must remain alert to its own economic priorities amid the instability and uncertainty facing the world economy.

title: Two Indians arrested with 8kg of ‘Kush’ cannabis at BIA
byline: Two Indian nationals have been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle around 8 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis into the country.

title: Temporary driving licenses for tourists at BIA but no Tuk licenses, says DMT
byline: A new service counter for the issuance of necessary driving licenses to foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka for travel will be launched today at the BIA premises in Katunayake, Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Kamal Amarasinghe, stated.

title: Grandson of former Indian PM Deve Gowda gets life sentence for rape
byline: A court in southern India has sentenced a prominent politician in the state of Karnataka to life in prison after being found guilty of raping one of his domestic staff.

title: Authorities urged to take action against foreigners engaged in business activities in Arugam Bay
byline: Israeli nationals arriving on tourist visas are having a significant impact on the tourism industry in the Arugam Bay area, according to local business owners.

title: One person injured in shooting incident reported in Matara
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Kapugama, Matara this morning (03), police stated.

title: Numerous issues have arisen due to delays in doctors’ transfers: GMOA
byline: Due to the actions of the Medical Services Unit of the Ministry of Health, serious issues have arisen concerning the transfers of over 23,000 doctors in Sri Lanka, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has stated.

title: Over 200,000 tourist arrivals recorded in July
byline: A total of 200,244 tourists arrived in the country in July 2025, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Iran fully reopens airspace after ceasefire with Israel
byline: Iran has lifted all remaining restrictions on its airspace that were imposed at the onset of its 12-day conflict with Israel, the country’s Civil Aviation Organization (CAO) has announced.

title: Tamil actor Madhan Bob passes away
byline: Veteran actor and comedian Madhan Bob, also known as Krishnamurthy, died at 71 in Chennai on Saturday (August 2).

title: Dua Lipa granted Kosovo citizenship
byline: Pop star Dua Lipa has said it “feels like my two sides are now one” after being granted Kosovo citizenship.

title: Protesters in Bangkok demand resignation of court-suspended prime minister following deadly conflict
byline: Protesters rallied Saturday in the Thai capital to demand the resignation of court-suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra and in support of the armed forces following a violent border dispute with Cambodia that killed more than three dozen people and displaced over 260,000.

title: Close associate of Kehelbaddara Padme, ‘Gampaha Deva’ nabbed at BIA
byline: A close associate of the notorious underworld criminal gang leader “Kehelbaddara Padme” has been arrested at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning (03).

title: 11-year-old schoolgirl dies after fainting; cause of death under investigation
byline: An 11-year-old schoolgirl from Kekirawa has died after collapsing due to a sudden fainting, police stated.

title: Associate of ‘Dubai Sudda’ arrested in Panadura
byline: A close associate of Prasad Chathuranga Kodagoda, also known as “Dubai Sudda” has been arrested by the Panadura Division Crime Investigation Unit.

title: Dormant Russia volcano erupts for first time in 475 years
byline: A volcano erupted for the first time in 475 years in Russia’s eastern Kamchatka region, the nation’s emergency authority said on Sunday, days after one of the strongest earthquakes on record hit the region.

title: Validity period of PIN issued for submission of tax returns for 2024/2025 extended
byline: The validity of the Personal Identification Number issued by the Inland Revenue Department for the submission of income tax returns for the year of assessment 2024/2025 has been extended.

title: New tsunami warning from Russia after Kuril Islands quake
byline: Russian officials warned that a tsunami wave of up to 19 centimeters (7.5 inches) could affect a section of the Kamchatka coast following a strong tremor on Sunday morning.

title: SLTB bus driver arrested in Nuwara Eliya while driving under the influence of alcohol
byline: A Sri Lanka Transport Board bus driver has been arrested by the Nuwara Eliya police for driving under the influence of alcohol.

title: Legal action against top public officials who fail to submit asset declarations: CIABOC
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has announced that legal action will be taken against any Executive Grade state officials who fail to submit their assets and liabilities declarations by 31 August 2025.

title: Number of shootings in 2025 increases to 76
byline: The number of shooting incidents reported across the country in 2025 has risen to 76.

title: One person injured in shooting incident in Matara
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Kapugama, Matara this morning (03), police stated.

title: DMT launches new service counter at BIA for foreign tourists
byline: A new branch office of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has been launched today (03) at the arrivals terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, providing foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka with the facility to obtain driving licenses valid in the country within a short period, depending on their visa duration.

title: No child will fail under the new education reforms - PM Harini
byline: The Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that under the new education reforms, no child will fail, and all children will have the opportunity to continue their education toward higher studies through both academic and vocational streams.

title: 7-year-old girl killed in wild elephant attack in Hambantota
byline: A 7-year-old child has died after being attacked by a wild elephant in the Sinukkugala area of Hambantota.

title: Acting Commissioner General of Buddhist Affairs appointed
byline: Kasun Wellahewa, who served as the Additional Commissioner of the Department of Buddhist Affairs, has been appointed as the Acting Commissioner General of Buddhist Affairs with immediate effect.

title: Israeli minister sparks anger by praying at sensitive Jerusalem holy site
byline: Israel’s far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir has visited the al-Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem and prayed there, violating a decades-old arrangement covering one of the most sensitive sites in the Middle East.
